intro: Actinotus novae-zelandiae, commonly known as the New Zealand mountain beauty, is a flowering plant native to New Zealand. It belongs to the family Stellariaceae and is characterized by its delicate, star-shaped white flowers. The plant typically grows in alpine and subalpine regions, thriving in cool, moist environments. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and often covered in fine hairs. Actinotus novae-zelandiae is well adapted to the harsh conditions of its native habitat, making it a resilient and unique species.
